newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares jump 3 pct on pledge to spur markets.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares jump 3 pct on pledge to spur markets.

text.p: Share prices on the Delhi Stock Exchange closed sharply higher on Wednesday, boosted by the government's pledge to take steps soon to revive lacklustre capital markets, brokers said.
The bourse's benchmark index closed 22.72 points, or 3.3 percent, higher at 712.25.
Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda told industrialists and economists on Tuesday that the government planned by mid-January to announce moves to boost industrial production and boost capital markets.

"The positive statement by the prime minister was the main force behind today's all-round rise in share prices which reversed yesterday's declining trends," said Suresh Aggarwal of Jaimata Securities.
On Tuesday the Delhi Stock Exchange's sensitive index lost 12.62 points.

"Sellers were not ready to offload their positions as they expected a further surge in coming sessions," said another trader. Reliance Industries rose 9.75 rupees to 218.10 on heavy foreign buying, brokers said.
State Bank of India surged 9.85 rupees to 246.
